ent.origin: Old English henn, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch hen and German Henne.

p.def: A female bird, especially of a domestic fowl.
p.phr: as rare (or scarce) as hen's teeth
p.eg: The female red junglefowl is leaner than tame hens.

ent.rhy: Adrienne, again, amen, Ardennes, Behn, Ben, Benn, Bren, cayenne, CÃ©vennes, Dairen, den.
